docs.snippet: As far as the stock market is concerned, U.S. President Donald Trump is, right now, his own worst enemy.

headline.print_headline: As Wall Street Sinks, Trump Is His Own Worst Enemy
headline.main: As Wall Street Sinks, Trump Is His Own Worst Enemy

docs.snippet: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Monday he did not see the United States and China responding to each other's tariff moves in a tit-for-tat escalation of trade tensions.

headline.print_headline: Trump Trade Adviser Does Not See U.S.-China Tariff Response 'Spiral'
headline.main: Trump Trade Adviser Does Not See U.S.-China Tariff Response 'Spiral'

docs.snippet: The U.S. Department of Justice on Wednesday sued California over a law that aims to give the state power to override the sale of federal lands, the latest battle between President Donald Trump and the nation's most populous state.

headline.print_headline: Trump Administration Sues California Over Sales of US Land
headline.main: Trump Administration Sues California Over Sales of US Land

docs.snippet: A federal judge has rejected adult film star Stormy Daniels' request for permission to question Donald Trump and schedule a trial soon in her lawsuit to end her agreement to remain silent about her alleged sexual encounter with the U.S. president.

headline.print_headline: Porn Star Daniels Loses Bid to Question Trump, Get Quick Trial
headline.main: Porn Star Daniels Loses Bid to Question Trump, Get Quick Trial

docs.snippet: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said Monday he plans to visit the U.S. this month to discuss North Korea with President Donald Trump ahead of expected summits between the North and the U.S. and South Korea.

headline.print_headline: Japan's Abe to Visit US to Discuss North Korea With Trump
headline.main: Japan's Abe to Visit US to Discuss North Korea With Trump

docs.snippet: Red paint was splashed across the sign outside President Donald Trump's golf club near his Florida estate.

headline.print_headline: Red Paint Splashed Across Trump Golf Club Sign in Florida
headline.main: Red Paint Splashed Across Trump Golf Club Sign in Florida

docs.snippet: A mural depicting President Donald Trump holding a handgun and school children in pools of blood has been painted over after it appeared in an Alabama city.

headline.print_headline: Mural of Trump With Gun, Bloody School Children Painted Over
headline.main: Mural of Trump With Gun, Bloody School Children Painted Over

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump launched his second attack in a week on Amazon.com Inc on Saturday, accusing the world's biggest online retailer of getting unfairly cheap rates from the U.S. Postal Service and not paying enough tax.

headline.print_headline: Trump Attacks Amazon, Again, Over U.S. Postal Rates
headline.main: Trump Attacks Amazon, Again, Over U.S. Postal Rates

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump, unable to get the U.S. Congress or Mexico to fully fund his border wall, will post National Guard troops along the Mexican frontier, officials said on Wednesday, in a move that was likely to escalate tensions with a key U.S...

headline.print_headline: Trump, Stymied on Wall, to Send Troops to U.S.-Mexico Border
headline.main: Trump, Stymied on Wall, to Send Troops to U.S.-Mexico Border

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump has told advisers he wants an early exit of U.S. troops from Syria, two senior administration officials said on Friday, a stance that may put him at odds with U.S. military officials who see the fight against Islamic State a...

headline.print_headline: Trump Tells Advisers He Wants U.S. Out of Syria-Senior Officials
headline.main: Trump Tells Advisers He Wants U.S. Out of Syria-Senior Officials
